Application Firewall and a Web Application Firewall is simply a layer
of a proxy layer that you put in front of your web application to to monitor
HTTP or HTTPS requests and to essentially separate through a series of
filters the good traffic from the bad traffic and prevent malicious requests from hitting your web application either
for purposes of stealing content or trying to do sequel injection attacks
those types of threats or also just floods where they may be denial of service attacks so again it's for layer
7 inspection and mitigation so what is the AWS web AWS wofe is a fully managed
web application firewall that runs on the AWS infrastructure and it protects
as most laughs do against things like malicious requests so again things like
sequel injection cross-site scripting it also will do sophisticated web traffic filtering and
you're able to create custom rules that will look at all kinds of different
attributes of a request again so that you can separate the good traffic from the bad traffic these can include things
like IP and geo match filters regular expressions for for very complex
expressions size constraints etc and then also you can through active
monitoring you can take action with the AWS wife so you have access to cloud
watch metrics and alarms sample blogs etc and you can programmatically through
the API for a wsof go and update your rules in response to these threats in
near real-time so AWS wofe is helpful
against a number of potential threats those include DDoS attacks so simple
kind of HTTP floods that are trying to overwhelm your your application
